title: Pedagogical Workshop for Designing Motor Sequence Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic science education and teacher training
context.additional_context: Focuses on designing and evaluating kinesthetic learning strategies for science classes for pre-service teachers. VR simulations are used to experience real classroom environments and apply teaching methodologies.

learning_goals: Participants can explain three or more sequence learning design strategies considering morning/afternoon learning timeframes
Participants develop and implement a teaching design framework linking sleep cycles with motor learning optimization in simulation environments
Participants analyze declarative components (sequence memory) and implicit components (motor optimization) of sequence learning separately through VR-based assessments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
